Strong recommendation. Low certainty of evidence. 4.2 Antidepressant medicines are not recommended for the treatment of children 12 years of age and below with depressive episode/disorder. Strong recommendation. Low certainty of evidence. 4.3 If psychosocial interventions alone prove ineffective in adolescents (13–17 years) with moderate-to-severe depression, referral to or consultation with a specialist should be offered, to undertake a more comprehensive assessment and to explore initiation of fluoxetine in combination with psychological treatments. Strong recommendation. Low certainty of evidence.
